alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Curry County; De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Guadalupe County; Harding County; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Northeast Highlands; Quay County; Roosevelt County; Southwest Chaves County; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 21 at 10:50AM MST until February 23 at 2:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM WEDNESDAY TO 2 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected today. For the High Wind Warning, southwest winds 35 to 55 mph with gusts of 60 to 80 mph expected Wednesday. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, northeast, and southeast New Mexico. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 7 PM MST this evening. For the High Wind Warning, from 8 AM Wednesday to 2 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Damage may occur to mobile homes, roofs, sheds, barns, outbuildings, and fences. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be very difficult, especially for high profile vehicles and cargo trains. Areas of blowing dust may reduce visibility below 1/2 mile at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of snow late Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday evening may produce low visibility with blowing snow and slick travel possible.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel.
